title: UN refugee agency warns more than 800,000 may flee Sudan
description: Some 73,000 have already left Sudan and the UN warns thousands will flee as fighting rages on and resources dwindle.

title: Violence erupts during French May Day protests
description: Nearly 300 protesters arrested as more than 100 police officers wounded during protests against pension reform.

title: Military ties top agenda as Biden meets Philippines’ Marcos Jr
description: Leaders to agree to greater US-Philippines military coordination, officials say, amid rising tensions in Asia Pacific.

title: Brazil: Illegal gold miners fatally shot in Indigenous territory
description: Government says four killed in exchange of gunfire after miners ambushed police, environmental agents on Yanomami lands.

title: What will the war in Sudan mean for Ethiopia?
description: Addis Ababa is concerned as the war next door shows no sign of ending.

title: US believes 20,000 Russians killed in Ukraine war since December
description: Russians have suffered 100,000 casualties since December, according to US estimates, as battle for Bakhmut grinds on.

title: Haiti on ‘brink of civil war’, humanitarian group warns
description: Mercy Corps sounds the alarm about escalating violence between gangs and civilians as Haiti faces hunger crisis.

title: Kuwait parliament dissolved by royal decree again
description: The legislature was only reinstated in March following a Constitutional Court and after a previous dissolution.

title: US religious freedom panel again recommends India for blacklist
description: For a fourth year, independent body says India should be singled out for discrimination against Muslims, other groups.

title: Syria agrees to curb drug trade in meeting with Arab ministers
description: The landmark talks come as efforts continue by some Arab states to reintegrate Syria into the Arab League.

title: DeSantis board approves suing Disney in response to lawsuit
description: The Disney lawsuit asks a judge to void the governor’s takeover of the theme park district previously controlled by it.

title: Canada reaches deal with 120,000 striking federal workers
description: Another 35,000 employees at Canada Revenue Agency remain on strike, demanding better pay and telework flexibility.

title: Sudanese civilian groups band together to provide essential aid
description: Civilians are helping Sudan's most vulnerable via food banks, donations, logistical coordination and medical support.

title: The US ‘war on terror’, 20 years after ‘mission accomplished’
description: Experts say 'lack of democratic accountability', transparency continue to define US operations against 'terror' threats.

title: France criticised at UN over police violence, racism
description: The UN's Human Rights Council calls on France to reduce police violence and take steps to address racism.

title: Cleopatra was Egyptian — whether Black or brown matters less
description: The controversy over the pharaoh's skin colour in Netflix's docudrama takes away from her powerful legacy.

title: Guinea’s contract teachers take to streets, threaten more strikes
description: Protesting teachers took to the streets across the country all last week demanding better rights and payment of arrears.

title: Trump lawyer seeks mistrial in rape case against ex-US president
description: Trump lawyer accuses judge of bias as US writer E Jean Carroll's civil lawsuit continues into second week in New York.

title: Ukraine to boycott World Judo Championships over Russian athletes
description: Ukrainian federation alleges that Russian judokas registered for championships in Qatar are 'active servicemen'.

title: I asked an AI chatbot about AI replacing humans
description: It told me it would take human jobs faster than the Kardashians ‘dump boyfriends’. Should we be worried?

title: Labour Day protests, strikes take over France, Italy, Netherlands
description: Workers and labour unions protest against government policies in France, Italy and the Netherlands.

title: China’s Ding Liren defies odds to be crowned world chess champion
description: Ding won the rapid chess playoff by 2.5 points to 1.5, capitalising on Ian Nepomniachtchi's mistakes.

title: ‘Dangerous precedent’: Tunisian police target books
description: Two books are confiscated, and a publishing house's stand is closed down at the Tunis International Book Fair.

title: UN holds crucial Afghanistan talks in Qatar, without Taliban
description: Talks will include diplomatic envoys and aid donors as the UN plans to press the Taliban to ease restrictions on women.

title: Autopsies begin on Kenyan cult members who starved to death
description: Kenyan authorities say they will check whether some of the 109 bodies recovered so far had missing organs.

title: Photos: May Day rallies across the world
description: Millions of workers and activists mark the day with rallies, protests to demand better working conditions and salaries.

title: It’s raining IMF in Suriname
description: Like other people in the Global South, the Surinamese are drowning in IMF-imposed austerity.

title: Nurses walk out in England, some critical services affected
description: The 28-hour strike is the latest stoppage in an increasingly bitter dispute with the government over pay and conditions.

title: JPMorgan to buy First Republic Bank as regulators seize control
description: First Republic Bank became the third major US institution to fail in two months.

title: Al Jazeera journalist released from detention in Egypt
description: Hisham Abdelaziz had been held by Egyptian authorities in pre-trial detention since 2019.

title: In Chad, pregnant Sudanese refugees give birth without shelter
description: Thousands of Sudanese displaced by infighting between the army and a powerful paramilitary group are trooping into Chad.

title: Photos: From prince to king, the life of Charles III
description: As King Charles settles into his new role, Al Jazeera takes a look at his life through photos.

title: What does fighting in Darfur mean for Sudan’s western frontier?
description: The power vacuum in western Darfur state risks drawing in fighters and weapons from Libya, CAR and Chad, analysts say.

title: The Pakistanis who chose to stay in Sudan, despite conflict
description: As thousands of foreign nationals escape the fighting, many Pakistani nationals say they will not leave.

title: Who is Paraguay’s president-elect, Santiago Pena?
description: The candidate of the right-wing Colorado Party and former IMF economist defeated centre-left challenger Efrain Alegre.

title: Uzbeks back President Mirziyoyev’s reforms proposal
description: Election commission says more than 90 percent of voters back President Mirziyoyev's constitutional amendments.

title: Ukraine says its air defences shoot down 15 Russian missiles
description: Three missiles get through and cause no casualties, Kyiv says, but one person reportedly killed in attacks in Kherson.

title: Top candidate for Thai PM gives birth two weeks before elections
description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra, leader of the opposition Pheu Thai Party, announces the birth of a son on Instagram.

title: Australia set for budget rebound, signals fiscal restraint
description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers expected to announce cautious budget as central bank fights high inflation.

title: Key events in Sudan as fighting hits 17 days
description: The country’s warring factions continue to fight despite saying they would extend a barely respected 72-hour ceasefire.

title: Ukraine war: Did Putin learn from Bush’s Iraq horrors?
description: From Wagner's crimes to the UN's role, the Iraq invasion offered a preview of the Ukraine war. But not all is the same.

title: Dozens of flights cancelled at Manila airport after power outage
description: About 40 domestic Cebu Pacific flights cancelled in Philippines after second power outage at main gateway this year.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 432
description: As the war enters its 432nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: UN sending relief chief to Sudan over ‘unprecedented’ situation
description: Martin Griffiths, travelling immediately, says people are struggling to get the food and water they need to survive.

title: Erdogan says Turkey has killed suspected ISIL leader
description: Turkish President discloses intelligence operation took place in Jinderes in northwestern Syria on Saturday.

title: South Korea’s exports suffer longest losing streak in 3 years
description: Exports decline for seventh straight month in April amid extended slump in sales to China.

title: ‘Not enough’: Hong Kong’s low-paid get $0.32 minimum wage bump
description: Increase of 6.25 percent after four-year freeze draws criticism from social welfare groups.

title: Santiago Pena wins Paraguay election after hard-fought campaign
description: Pena's conservative Colorado Party was facing a tough challenge from the left over corruption, and poverty.

title: ‘Tools more than humans’: HK domestic workers fight for rights
description: After years of exploitation and abuse, Hong Kong’s 340,000 migrant domestic workers are fighting back in the courts.

title: Marcos Jr treads a fine line over military ties as he heads to US
description: Philippines president has tilted towards US since taking office a year ago, but is keeping Beijing close.
